website_summaries.verdict: This multi-functional laptop tray is large enough to fit a 17-inch laptop and mouse. Fully adjustable leg size for extra comfort.
pros: Auto-lock allows you to easily change the angle of the tray and leg height
Ideal for dining or working from bed or the couch
Folds down easily to store away when not in use
Engineered MDF wood finish is easy to clean
cons: Some users report it being too tall for them

customer_reviews.title: Was fairly simple to assemble and packaging was perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my father. He loves it and uses it regularly. Was fairly simple to assemble and packaging was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby Maury

customer_reviews.title: In the first day it broke nails and screws are ...
customer_reviews.text: In the first day it broke nails and screws are too short and came out of the plywood, seller doesn't have return options and never respond my email regarding that. don't buy..!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy 🌼

customer_reviews.title: A great upgrade from the table i had before.
customer_reviews.text: First let me say the table i used to have was sturdy, strong and lasted a while but my main concern was mobility and compacting. With that being said this table was everything i was looking for and its adjustble for different hieghts and angles for specific uses like a tablet or laptop or even a breakfast table. I have a small room so i dont have a lot of space for a small office desk and a chair so this works well and its sturdier than i thought. I recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C.

customer_reviews.title: I like it, my friends like it, I even made this video for my blog about it
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I've had it for a week or two. Construction is good, materials seem quality, and it is very versatile (folds many different ways). The main use is for my laptop while I'm on the sofa, but I also use it to mount an iPad when I'm doing a video conference. I even use it during parties to put snacks on top of it. 4 instead of 5 stars because I wish it was priced less (I paid around $39), and sometimes the height elevators don't work like I want (they don't lock into place at the bottom, I think?).
customer_reviews.author: Nick Gray

customer_reviews.title: The packaging was great, almost Apple Inc
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed so far. The packaging was great, almost Apple Inc. like. See photos for more. It feels quite sturdy and is a great size for a laptop or writing. It raises to a very comfortable writing height. You could use it for just about anything. It looks quite nice and easily folds flat into a fairly thin size. There is a little ledge to hold items in place, but you don't have to install it. Like that flexibility. Too early to comment on durability, but first impressions were very positive.
customer_reviews.author: William F

customer_reviews.title: ... she recently fractured her leg and this product is amazing!! Adjusts to her needs and has different ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my toddler she recently fractured her leg and this product is amazing!! Adjusts to her needs and has different purposes, she eats, reads, plays with her phone! Love it. There is no assembly required started using it as soon as I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Loida Maculan

customer_reviews.title: A good compact bed table
customer_reviews.text: The product is as it is described. A good bed table. I mostly study on my bed and this table helps a lot by providing a firm base to keep notepads while writing and a laptop while typing. My Laptop is 15 inches and it sits perfectly on the table. Table can be adjusted according to the height and angle required.
customer_reviews.author: Abhimanyu

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: broke down after a month and a half. One leg just came out and revealed it's held by very tiny screws. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Al Gal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 17in Laptop
customer_reviews.text: This table might feel flimsy but it's not. Once it locks on I have had no issues with it. I got it for my 17in laptop which I use with a mouse, and it has plenty of room. I like the rubber patting it comes with and I really like how it didn't smell bad. I had bought another table I had to send back because of the smell. It can work as a homework table as well. Very good little table.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal  Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: This is a life changer!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best birthday gift I have EVER received.. you will never need a computer desk again. I am a pregnant graphic designer and my husband got it for me with one of those memory foam linenspa pillows with arm support, then i purchased a comfilife coccyx pillow, and i now can work again for hours on an end with perfect posture and my legs stretched & elevated. I am simply more comfortable than ever before! Getting rid of my desktop next, because I know i won’t be using it anymore even after pregnancy!
customer_reviews.author: Vness

customer_reviews.title: Broke when adjusting just 4 months after purchasing
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it lasted but I just went to adjust it and the right leg/arm just broke off. I've only owned it for 4 months so that seems pretty unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Palmieri-Coonley

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy plastic junk. Arrived with the gray plastic edge/rim cracked and just appears very cheap. Would be a fair price for $15, not $45. Steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: B1

customer_reviews.title: I also find it annoying that the seller includes in the package a message ...
customer_reviews.text: It's OK, but: 1) Seller needs to clearly state what the desktop is made of. The description is deceptive, it says "American cherry" (but that is the color, not the material it is made of), and "engineered wood" (what is that?). 2) Lowest position is not quite low enough for me. I also find it annoying that the seller includes in the package a message encouraging people to post positive reviews, and to not post negative reviews but to call them instead. This artificially inflates satisfaction ratings and causes people to think it's an amazing product when it is just OK.
customer_reviews.author: Amina

customer_reviews.title: And I'm very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I had searched many stand desk and finally decided to buy I this one. And I'm very happy with it. I bought the biggest size to put my 17" laptop on the top and it worked perfectly. I still have room for my mouse. It's really sturdy and in good quality. I strongly recommend!

customer_reviews.author: JJJMOM

customer_reviews.title: By far the best I've found
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I've been looking for a lap desk for months, one that has a lip to hold a laptop, swiveled and of sturdy construction. Although the top isn't the wood I was looking for originally, the legs are sturdy, easy to use and amazing. Folds down, making it easy to store as well. Lip also comes off if you aren't looking for that feature. You can raise and drop the height, and swivel the angles making it a comfortable and easy to use desk.
customer_reviews.author: orlavaguy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lazy college kids, like me.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this cautiously, but after using it for less than twenty minutes... I love it. I take classes online, and needed something so I could use my laptop in bed, and it works perfectly! The table is wide enough for my laptop, phone, and mouse all at once. The legs open far enough that I can sit with my legs crossed, and with the tilting features, I can type comfortably without needing to bend my wrists! I'd recommend this to anyone, especially for other college students who don't have enough space for a traditional desk, or don't want to be uncomfortable during long study sessions. Everything about this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but the legs are too long
customer_reviews.text: The construction is nice, and the design is clever. Unfortunately, the shortest length of the legs are too tall for comfortable use on a couch. I have to sit on the floor for it to be a usable height at its lowest setting. I would have preferred a shorter length on the lowest setting of the legs than an ultimately longer length when fully extended. I had no intentions of working while standing up.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hood

customer_reviews.title: Great table but strange shade of green in white grain.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice table for school assignments. It could be a little bigger and the white color has a strange hint of lime green. I would've selected the wood grain if I'd known. Otherwise, its a good product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: it's perfect to work in the bed at any day time
customer_reviews.text: Wow, it's perfect to work in the bed at any day time! I use a logitech trackball mouse, my laptop and a Yuesong cooling device and everything fit perfect... The most important aspect is that the table is wood made and the retractable legs offer perfect stability!. Nothing more to say, just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Alberto Monroy Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Same issue with two separate orders! Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I just returned my second table after I received it today. I ordered and returned the first one last week. Both had the same issue. The left leg was wobbly and unstable. I really wanted to like the table because it was good size for studying in bed but I am not the table will be stable enough with the wobble. I was excited to receive the second table today but was really disappointed to find the same issue with the second table.

customer_reviews.title: Serious design flaw
customer_reviews.text: In many ways this is a nice laptop table but it has a fatal flaw. The rest piece at the bottom of the table designed to hold up the laptop is too high. It makes it almost impossible to type because it is so uncomfortable. Fine to use if just watching videos etc. but it could have been so much better.
customer_reviews.author: C.V.

customer_reviews.title: Probably would work great on the couch if you are skinny
customer_reviews.text: Probably would work great on the couch if you are skinny, but if you have a little extra love, it doesn't stay in place very well.

customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if I am doing wrong, but the tilt and height adjustment is very loose, I think I finally set to where I like it, but it moves around. I am not even using it any more. Update edited on 3/6/2018 Avantree Support Desk reached out to me after I left a disappointing comment and offered to send me a replacement. customer_reviews.author: crm

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy + cheap
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning this item. It's really not sturdy at all. the legs don't lock when you fold them out. So it kind of wobbles. also the height adjustment is wonky - seems like the notches aren't deep enough or something. Overall, just feels/looks cheaply made - not worth the $70 at all. Might be okay if you plan to work on a very flat setting. I wanted it for my bed. otherwise, skip it.
customer_reviews.author: M.L

customer_reviews.title: Useful, yet overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: The table in itself is very helpful for posture and to avoid neck strain when working from home for long hours. I particularly like the height adjustability feature and the space for my laptop and mouse (I got the big one). However, I can see the material is rather cheap and fear that it will rapidly deteriorate. This is a highly overpriced desk. I suspect the sellers are getting away with this due to the current pandemic and people working from home. if it was between $30-45, I would say money well spent, but the price is just outrageous for such cheap material.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very flimsy. The legs, when the unfold to their upright position, don't have a definitive locking mechanism. They lock in by "tension" so to speak. When I put it on my bed (an unstable, non-rigid surface), and rest my arms on it, the legs wobble left and right, and want to buckle. I wanted this as a laptop stand to use in bed, and it simply doesn't even come close. It also is extremely cheap in both look and feel. I can't imagine it would last very long. This may work for you depending on what you want it for. However it did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: This Guy!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Little Table
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this table to use mostly for coloring, so that I wouldn't have to sit at a table. This table is lightweight, stable, portable, folds flat for easy transport and storage, and is fully adjustable. I love it and see myself using it often. It makes a perfect portable desk for using a laptop, writing letters, paying bills, and so on. It can be used as a bed tray for breakfast in bed. It's quite sturdy and stable. It has stayed put as I've used it. It's very simple to adjust. I really cannot think of a thing that I do not like about this handy little table.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.

customer_reviews.text: This is a great little table. If you like sitting on the floor to do work or want to have a little tray table while sitting on the couch, this is a great buy. It's dead simple to use and adjust and feels very sturdy. Like the pictures show it can be folded up and take up very little space stored in a closet or even under the couch for super quick access! (Dell XPS 13 displayed on table for size reference.)

I mean it doesn't have to be The standard, but it can be an optional thing that the customer could get one that folds in half or the current style, which is great. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Abdulmohsen Almassud

customer_reviews.title: Versatile little table.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a little table for use while sitting in bed to read, eat, watch movies from i-pad etc.., this table is easy to fold down to a flat item for storage, has some leeway for height adjustment as well as a tilt ability that is easy to use, and a stopper that you can elect not to use that would allow proping your computer or kindle etc.. so it does not slide off the edge of the table. Light weight and versatile. My husband has been very happy with it. We have considered multiple versions of breakfast tables/trays and this one does much more for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: H. Lee

customer_reviews.title: ) The stand design seems well done (Folding flat is great since it fits under the sofa
customer_reviews.text: My primary use case for this product is from a seated position. (For reference I'm 6ft & 200lb.) The stand design seems well done (Folding flat is great since it fits under the sofa.) but even the lowest setting seems a little tall. Fortunately, support got in touch with me and it sounds like they have a solution for that coming up.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Quality Item
customer_reviews.text: I have neck issues and needed to be able to read, use my phone, tablet etc. without having to bend my neck downward. This item is surprisingly sturdy and made of quality material. I'm 5'7" and my husband is 6'5" and it works for both us us. The top of the table reminds me of a lecture hall table. The adjustments on the table seem sturdy and reliable. The legs have padding on the bottom of them so they won't tear up your couch material. There is plenty of leg room (width and height), but I was careful to measure my leg width and the couch cushion width.
customer_reviews.author: sk8ter

customer_reviews.title: Can't use as shown
customer_reviews.text: I wanted it specifically to use on my sofa. It was shown in a video and in the name/description for such use, but my "normal" sofa was not "deep" enough unless I took the back cushion off. The front legs were hanging off the sofa by more than 6 inches. I sent it back the next day for a refund. I loved it - that's why I give it an extra star. The quality is great. I just couldn't use it for the purpose it promised. If you just want to use it on the floor or on a bed - it would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mckenna Hallett

customer_reviews.title: I use my desk frequently
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned from reading the reviews, but I did my research and decided to try this particular desk. I am so glad that I did. It is sturdy enough for my 17" laptop and using it as a rest for my hands/wrists as I type. When fully extended, it is slightly wobbly, but nothing I've been concerned with. The gray raised bumpers at the bottom (lower edge) of the desk are detachable, which is excellent. The bumpers got in my way, so the removal of these items make this desk much more flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa O

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for about everything
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a lap desk for my work computer. The legs are sturdy, the adjustable height setting “clicks” are solid. One thing I don’t use is the removable plastic bar - using the rubber nubs is better for my wrists and gives more “space” to move about the desk. I’ve had this since January and the only thing that’s happened is I’ve lost one of the rubber feet at the bottom of the leg, but as much abuse I’ve put this against, it’s not even a big deal. To be fair, I lost the rubber foot so it’s my fault. I’d buy this again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for plus sized people.
customer_reviews.text: This table is amazing! I am a plus sized person and it is so nice to be able to sit under the table comfortably. I solved the problem of it being too wide for me to sit sideways on my couch by putting one side on an ottoman. This table is very sturdy and the tilt works easily, with a snapping lock that makes me feel confident it won't shift. I have even used it on my dining table to bring my laptop higher so I can use it standing when my back aches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neetto Height Adjustable Laptop Bed Table
customer_reviews.text: Sorry not sure how to put photos here! I like this table, I now have one for my Lazy Boy Recliner, and also one in my bedroom, for when my body decides it's time to shut down, I wanted this because I like to write down Characters in books I read. It holds my Notebook perfectly, I also taped down, a non-slide piece. and at the top, I can secure with velcro, a small pen holder. I've looked for the perfect bed table, and so far this one is my favorite.

I cannot use a product that moves every time i try to type.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.

customer_reviews.author: jen3

customer_reviews.title: Great lap table for laptop, reading, homework...
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this lap table is that it's sturdy, there is enough leg room to not feel cramped, and it's really light weight without being flimsy. Some reviews indicated it could tip over as the "feet" extend to the edge of the sofa, well, just be careful that's all. I've used it with my laptop for work daily since I got it and I LOVE it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great CS
customer_reviews.text: It's 9.8" high, too small for a standing desk unless you are very short. Unfortunately, I read only a portion of the verbose amount of written info, watched the video and ordered. The video shows the taller product and NOT this product. So now, yet again with a misrepresented product on this site, I have to pack up and take to UPS, which is such a pain. UPDATE: Avantree contacted me, apologized for and removed video from product description, and then sent me the taller version -- all done very promptly. I'm using the Avantree with my rain design mStand, and the combo makes a great, easily convertible standing desk. Very pleased with their exemplar customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Fifitrixiebelle

customer_reviews.title: Go for other products

All the joints are made of cheap plastic. I wouldn't think it will last very long. But I'm hesistant to return simply coz it will deduct some 10$ for return via online. Otherwise its just an okay product.
customer_reviews.author: MuSe

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Function: bed desk, work desk, and bed tray!
customer_reviews.text: I love this table. It is very versatile. I use it when when I’m sitting on my bed when I need to work from my laptop. I wide enough for my 17 inch laptop and a mouse. I use a mouse and you need to have a mouse pad for the mouse to work as it should. It well built very sturdy to use why sitting in bed. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: S.P.

customer_reviews.title: Mission Accomplished
customer_reviews.text: It does everything I needed. I can sit on the couch and work on my computer without contorting my body in a way that makes my body ache. However, based on the pictures, I thought the table was silver and white. Now that I have it, I can see that there are silver and white parts, but the tabletop is a yellowish, fake looking wood laminate. It looks cheap. I will keep it, but it is ugly. Good thing I can easily fold it up and hide it under the couch when I'm not using it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Masters

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and roomy!
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect for me. I use it on the couch for eating. It’s roomy enough for my phone stand and phone so I can watch something while eating. Great as a desk as well. Lots of room for my legs and a generous surface for books, plates etc. Folds up easily. Really a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry

customer_reviews.title: A good laptop standing desk option
customer_reviews.text: It works well as a collapsible and portable tabletop standing-desk surface for a laptop, my use. Large is a good size, leaving room for a mouse, mouse pad and note pad. The only shortcoming is that it is not as rigid as one might want, so it flexes if you lean an elbow on it. That is why I give three stars instead of five. If you don't require a rigid structure, this is a good choice. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Spudman

customer_reviews.title: this is great. i like to put my laptop on my ...
customer_reviews.text: just WOW, this is great. i like to put my laptop on my bed at night to surf the web and watch tv but my laptop gets hot and i do not like the positioning i have to keep doing to keep it right. This table solves all my issues and it is stable, does not fall over and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: jaysin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Perfect in every way.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this portable tray so that I could work on my laptop in bed and recliner as I was recovering from surgery. I could not be more pleased with this product. Its legs fold up easily so I could tuck it away on the side of my chair when it wasn't be used and it is very stable when my arms were resting on it while I was typing. I love that it fits between the arms of the chair and even on the couch when I was sitting sideways. Perfect work surface, perfect stability, perfect angle for use. I recommend it to everyone for all the reasons other reviewers have said.
customer_reviews.author: Paula R. Schoeff

customer_reviews.title: Average Laptop Table
customer_reviews.text: I've used it work on my 15" Surface Book 2 while sitting on the floor. It's ok and i think sturdy enough for this heavy laptop but would probably be better if your laptop was lighter. There isn't too much clearance for my legs i don't use it as a bed table for fear that I might accidentally kick it!. Folding it is easy enough and I always raise it to its maximum extension.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for my 17" laptop so that I finally had one that had room to have the laptop and the mouse. I wanted one that would allow me to work anywhere. I bought this one because it tilts and you can change the height. While it is sturdy and very well made and is 80% of what I was looking for I don't like the height. It adjusts up pretty high but I can't see the use for that unless you wanted to put it on a desk and stand; it does not adjust down far enough to use comfortably while sitting on the chair or the couch. Other than that it is a nice piece.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for in bed computer work!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver for me. I suffer from ME and Fibromyalgia and this table allows me to prop my computer and phone up without having to hold it on my legs. The adjusting mechanisms from high to low or tilting are very simple to use. My only issue is it is kind of bulky when folded up and difficult to sit on my floor when I am finished with it at night. Have not figured out how to solve that issue yet. Overall, I like it enough to keep it, and use it frequently and it has allowed me to have a bit of a life even with a chronic illness.
customer_reviews.author: Danel LaRose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lap Desk, for me anyway
customer_reviews.text: This desk meets all of my expectations. It fits on every chair I need it to, the legs can be adjusted independently of one another, so if one sinks into the chair more, I just raise it up a little higher so the table is still level. This table is just the right amount of room for my work laptop and a notebook side by side. Sometimes, the leg raising things that hold it slip a little bit, but so far that hasn’t been a major issue. It’s not as sturdy as a regular desk of course, but has done very well for this time of working from home during a pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Needed an upgrade from an different model. Works great I use this for my 17.3 inch laptop, chromebook, tablet, cellphone, eating. I have enough room. Great build and quality.

customer_reviews.title: Works just as described!
